newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austrian bonds firm as rate cut hopes revived.
newsitem.headline: Austrian bonds firm as rate cut hopes revived.

text.p: 1540 GMT - Austrian bonds continued recent advance on Thursday, tracking German gains after Bundesbank council member Hans-Juergen Krupp revives hopes for rate cuts by saying the central bank could not ignore a weak economy.
Traders said they expected the friendly mood to persist, see Europe decoupling from the U.S.
* 10 year benchmark 5.875 pct bond maturing July 2006 up 10 bps at 101.00 to yield 5.73 (5.74) pct in bourse trade, quoted post-market at 100.93/101.03 to yield 5.74/73.
* At the near end, five-year 5.50 percent bond maturing March 2001 up 15 bps at 104.25 to yield 4.42 (4.46) percent in bourse trade, quoted post-market at 104.28/104.36 to yield 4.41/39 percent.
* AGB future up 29 bps at 108.40 on turnover of 724 lots.
* 10-year spread to German bunds up one at three bps, five-year spread down four at nine bps.
* Money market rates mixed with three-month VIBOR steady at 3.350 and overnight money down a tick at 3.12/3.37. -- Vienna newsroom, +431 53112 257
